column4: (Gutsy) How do I download the Python drivers for Chess in 3D?
If you install chess with synaptic then you should already have everything it needs.
I have Chess, but it needs Open GL Python stuff to run in 3D view.
How did you install it
I never installed anything!
Chess came with 7.10 by default.
So you need to get your video drivers correctly installed
OpenGL Python bindings and the GtkGLExt Python bindings are what I need.
I see that when you try to enable 3d in the preinstalled chess
Yeah
http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=427997    suggests trying brutal chess instead
Did you install ccsm as well
I'll pass on Brutal.
I just installed CCSM. Looks good. But I don't know how to play with these effects after enabling them. ;)
system  pref  advanced
I know, I was in there.
I know how to enable them, but don't know how to press keys so it will do the effects.
YOu want to enable the cube for starters
ctrl alt   left mouse button and move mouse
That is so cool!
if you go to the actions tab on effects you can see the keys to enable or kill it
What are some critical drivers/programs I should install while I have a working Internet connection?
WHatever you think you want..
